intro: Ternstroemia nashii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hala tree, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are usually white or pink in color. Ternstroemia nashii plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian forests and is considered a keystone species in its native habitat.
